note: ADHD-Optimized. Mechanics: Body Doubling, Timers, Novelty, Micro-Steps. Goal: Immediate Identity Validation.

high: Commit code that closes a ticket (Definition of Done)
Refactor one messy component to be 'beautiful' (aesthetic dopamine)
Build a working prototype feature in a 45-min sprint
medium: Rubber Duck debugging: Explain the problem aloud to an object
Review your own code from yesterday and find one improvement
Write out the logic flow (pseudocode) before touching the keyboard
low: Write one comment in the code explaining exactly what to do next
Fix one tiny, visible UI bug for an instant win
Close all browser tabs not related to the current task

high: Publish or Submit a draft (overcome the fear of 'not ready')
Write 500 words of 'garbage' draft without hitting backspace
Edit a full section until it sounds like 'you'
medium: Outline the 3 key beats for the next section (don't write, just structure)
Rewrite 3 sentences to be shorter and punchier
Read one piece of writing you envy to analyze how they did it
low: Write 3 potential headlines or opening hooks
Open the document and leave the cursor at the end of the last sentence
Write down one sensory detail (smell, sound) in your notes

high: Finish one asset to 'Portfolio Quality' (no endless tweaking)
Do 30 minutes of rapid iteration sketches (speed > perfection)
Export the current version and look at it on a different screen
medium: Organize your layers/files so 'Future You' doesn't hate 'Present You'
Find 3 distinct references that clash, and combine them
Critique your own work: List 3 things to fix, then stop looking
low: Draw one 'bad' shape on the canvas to break the blank page fear
Rename and save your current project file properly
Change the color of one element to see if it pops

high: Do the 'Scary Ask' (sales call, pitch, or negotiation) first
Draft a spec that unblocks your team (remove yourself as the bottleneck)
Review metrics and make one decision based on data, not gut
medium: Send 3 updates to people waiting on you (close open loops)
Block out 'Deep Work' time on tomorrow's calendar
Write down the single biggest risk to the business right now
low: Send one genuine 'thank you' to a user or team member
Review your top 3 priorities for the week
Write down one assumption you are currently making

high: Ship/Submit a project that is 80% perfect (Kill perfectionism)
Delete a project from your list that you know you won't finish
Do the final 10% of a task (the polishing) in one sitting
medium: Define exactly what 'Done' looks like for one task
Identify the one bottleneck stopping you and remove it
Tell one person you will finish X by 5 PM (Social pressure)
low: Open the project file of an unfinished task
Write down the very next physical step (e.g., 'Open email')
Close 3 browser tabs related to 'research' for new projects

high: Execute a strategy-based trade/transfer (no emotion)
Deep dive research into one asset (read the boring docs)
Rebalance your portfolio percentages
medium: Read one article that disagrees with your investment thesis
Update your net worth tracker
Review your automated payment settings
low: Log one transaction from today
Check your balance without judging yourself
Read one financial headline

high: Complete one stage of the build (e.g., sanding, assembly)
Practice a specific technique for 30 minutes (drills)
Finish a small piece and take a photo of it
medium: Mise-en-place: Set out all tools/materials for tomorrow
Clean and maintain your primary tool
Sketch the dimensions/plan for the next piece
low: Touch your project or materials for 30 seconds
Tidy one small corner of your workspace
Write down the next single step required

high: Explain a complex concept simply (Feynman Technique)
Do a practice test/problem set with a timer running
Write the first draft of a section (ugly draft)
medium: Turn raw notes into questions (Active Recall prep)
Review the 3 hardest concepts from yesterday
Find one primary source for your current topic
low: Read just the abstract or summary of the text
Write down one question you want to answer today
Organize your digital workspace for 5 minutes

high: Record a full take and listen to it critically
Practice the hardest 10 seconds of the piece 10 times
Perform for a real audience (even just one friend)
medium: Analyze a pro's performance for one specific technique
Warm up your voice/instrument/body for 10 minutes
Edit the script or score markings
low: Stand in your performance posture for 1 minute
Play/Speak the very first line
Check your equipment cables/batteries

high: Work on the 'One Thing' for 45 mins (Timer ON, Phone OFF)
Say 'No' to a request that steals your time
Complete the hardest task first (Eat the Frog)
medium: Clear your physical desk of everything but the current task
Use a website blocker for 2 hours
Plan tomorrow's schedule with 30% buffer time
low: Put your phone in a drawer or another room
Write down the single most important task on a sticky note
Close one tab or app you aren't using

high: Clear one entire surface (desk, table, counter) completely
Set a timer for 15 minutes and 'speed clean' one room
Process a 'doom pile' of papers/clothes until it's gone
medium: Put 5 things back in their actual home
Do the dishes/laundry immediately (don't let it sit)
Make the bed (sets the tone for the day)
low: Throw away 3 pieces of obvious trash
Take one cup/plate to the kitchen
Straighten one item (e.g., a rug or picture frame)

high: Do the 'scary' thing for 10 minutes (Exposure Therapy)
Journal a 'Reality Check' on a negative thought
Sit with an uncomfortable emotion for 5 mins (don't fix it)
medium: Write down the 'Worst Case Scenario' and a plan for it
Walk outside for 10 minutes without headphones
Do 3 cycles of Box Breathing (4-4-4-4)
low: Touch 3 textured objects (Grounding technique)
Name your current emotion (e.g., 'I feel overwhelmed')
Drink a glass of cold water slowly

high: Have the difficult conversation you're avoiding
Host a gathering or initiate a specific plan
Listen for 10 mins without interrupting or advising
medium: Send a thoughtful text to someone you miss
Write a thank-you note (physical or digital)
Ask a question instead of talking about yourself
low: Make eye contact and smile at someone
Send a quick 'thinking of you' emoji
Put your phone away during a meal

high: Execute a special outing or 'date' (plan + do)
Play/Talk for 20 mins with phone in another room
Repair a conflict immediately (apologize/discuss)
medium: Tell them one specific thing you appreciate
Prepare a comfort meal or environment for them
Practice active listening (repeat back what they said)
low: Hug for 20 seconds (oxytocin boost)
Put phone face down when they enter the room
Send a photo or update to them

high: Give specific, actionable feedback (hard but necessary)
Delegate a task you usually hoard
Run a 1-on-1 focused purely on their career growth
medium: Ask 'What is blocking you?' and remove the obstacle
Publicly credit a team member for a win
Write down the team's goal for the week clearly
low: Send one encouraging message to the team
Listen for 2 minutes in a meeting without speaking
Check in on a team member's energy (not work)

high: Try something new where you will likely fail
Deep dive a topic you disagree with (Steel Man argument)
Create something 'bad' just to see what happens
medium: Take a different route home or walk a new street
Read an article from a completely new field
Ask 'Why?' three times about a normal assumption
low: Google a term you didn't understand
Stop and look at the sky/environment for 1 minute
Write down one question you have about the world

high: Complete the workout even if it's 'ugly'
Push to 90% effort on one set/interval
Prep healthy meals for 3 days
medium: Do a 10-minute mobility/stretch routine
Log your workout stats (don't ignore the data)
Pack your gym bag for tomorrow
low: Put on your workout shoes (The Threshold Rule)
Fill your water bottle
Do 5 air squats right now

high: Play 3 ranked matches with full focus (stop if tilted)
Review a replay of a loss to find 3 mistakes
Practice one mechanic in training mode for 20 mins
medium: Take a 5-minute eye/stretch break between matches
Clean your mousepad/desk setup
Read patch notes to understand the meta
low: Do a 30-second hand/wrist stretch
Drink water instead of soda/energy drink
Stop playing immediately after 2 losses

high: Complete a 30-minute flow/routine
Hold a pose for 60 seconds longer than you want to
Meditate for 15 minutes after moving
medium: Do 3 Sun Salutations or basic stretches
Lie down and focus on breath for 5 minutes
Roll out your mat (even if you don't start)
low: Stand up and try to touch your toes
Sit on the floor instead of the couch
Take 3 deep belly breaths

high: Leave the house for 1 hour without a phone
No screens from 8 PM until bed
Delete a scrolling app for 24 hours
medium: Turn screen to Grayscale mode
Walk without headphones/podcasts
Read a physical book for 15 minutes
low: Leave phone in another room for 5 minutes
Turn off one specific notification type
Look out a window instead of your phone

high: Get in bed 8 hours before wake-up time (Phone away)
Wake up at first alarm (No Snooze)
Get 10 minutes of morning sunlight
medium: Turn off overhead lights 1 hour before bed
Write a 'Brain Dump' list to clear thoughts
Make the bedroom cool and dark
low: Set your alarm for tomorrow
Drink a glass of water upon waking
Put phone charger across the room

high: Cook a meal from scratch with whole foods
Zero added sugar or processed snacks today
Hit your protein/macro target exactly
medium: Drink water instead of a calorie drink
Add one vegetable to your next meal
Stop eating when 80% full
low: Drink a glass of water before eating
Put a healthy snack on your desk
Read the ingredient label of one item

high: Set a timer for 20 mins and race against it
Do the task you are dreading most first
Produce one tangible result (draft, rep, cleaned item)
medium: Prepare your environment for tomorrow (Mise-en-place)
Review your progress and adjust the plan
Spend 10 minutes learning something related to your goal
low: Do the habit for just 2 minutes (Two Minute Rule)
Write down your intention for the day
Remove one distraction from your desk
